results.title: Rescue by helicopter
results.creator_credit: Bern Gandy, John Martin-Jones, Australia. Royal Australian Navy and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Standard procedures for rescue by a helicopter. Vertical take off and landing, and the ability to hover make it a valuable rescue craft. Shows correct method of approach, putting on the rescue strap, and giving the winding signal. Provided rules are adhered to helicopter rescue is quite safe. Edited by Richard Mitchell.

results.title: Requiem for a faith
results.creator_credit: Irving Hartley, Elda Hartley and Hartley Productions
results.brief_description: The traditional life of Tibet is depicted by Huston Smith, Professor of Philosophy at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. Smith shows the extent to which traditional customs have been invaded and corroded by the West. All social and economic activity revolves around religious practice. The importance of the Dalai Lama is emphasised. Set in Gyuto Tantric Monastery in Northern India, this moving film explores the essence of Tibetan Buddhism and focuses on the unusual chants of the Gyuto monks, whose training enables them to chant in chords. The film was shot mainly in Dalhousie, India, where the two Tantric Colleges, Gyuto and Gyume, were re-established in exile.

results.title: Republic day: India
results.creator_credit: Ezra Mir and Films Division, Government of India
results.brief_description: The celebrations in Delhi on India’s national day, 26th January. The President drives in State to take the salute at a parade of armed forces, floats representing the various provinces and industries, folk dances and marching schoolchildren. Illuminations and fireworks enliven the city at night. The following day a fold dance festival shows the dances of many districts. The military ceremony of Beating the Retreat concludes the festivities.

results.title: Republic Day, 1955
results.creator_credit: M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: The pageantry witnessed in the capital on Republic Day. Colorful tableaux representing the achievements and developments of the national plans in different areas, the spectacular parade of the three units of the Armed Forces, and a brilliant display of fireworks.

results.title: Reptiles of Western Australia
results.brief_description: Reptiles of four different types are shown: snakes, lizards, tortoises and turtles, land crocodiles, which are found in Western Australia. All are cold-blooded, and need the sun to warm them and encourage them to move. Close-up shots reveal the features of each type; the turtle’s skeleton attached to its hard back; fascinating lizards with frills, spikes or blue tongues; snakes’ markings and their fangs in action; fresh-water, harmless crocodiles and flesh-eaters which live in salt water.

results.title: Reproduction of plants
results.brief_description: Reproduction of Liverworts, observed under a microscope. When an egg cell is fertilised it produces a new plant, the sporophyte, a capsule containing spores. Each spore produces a gametophyte which in turn produces a sporophyte. This “alternation of generations” takes place through countless generations of liverworts.
results.description: Reproduction of Liverworts, observed under a microscope. When an egg cell is fertilised it produces a new plant, the sporophyte, a capsule containing spores. results.title: Report to the Mist
results.brief_description: Video clip by AB Original for their song ‘Report to the Mist’ off their 2016 album Reclaim Australia.

constellations_other.name: Black documentary and truth telling
constellations_other.description: Essie Coffey was a trailblazer of Indigenous filmmaking, being the first Aboriginal woman to direct a documentary. The film spotlights the outspoken voice Coffey utilised to convey the realities faced by Aboriginal people and to encourage resistance to assimilation.

results.description: Video clip by AB Original for their song ‘Report to the Mist’ off their 2016 album Reclaim Australia.
description_for_label: Video clip by AB Original for their song ‘Report to the Mist’ off their 2016 album Reclaim Australia.

results.title: Report on wheat
results.creator_credit: Roy A. Driver and Herschells Films
results.brief_description: A survey of Victoria’s second largest industry - the production of wheat. Stresses the need for increased production to meet the requirement of local and overseas buyers. Shows the work being done by the State Research Farm, the Victorian Department of Agriculture and the agricultural colleges in this direction; the checking of flour for quality; the breeding, growing and harvesting of wheat varieties; the development of improved wheat strains; bread manufacture; the bulk handling of wheat at rail heads and storage depots.

results.title: Report on pollution
results.creator_credit: Richard Broad, Ian Martin and Thames Television
results.brief_description: Beginning with the notion that all life on earth depends on critical balances in networks and cycles of ecology, the film demonstrates how particular forms of pollution are critically threatening the earth’s ability to sustain life. The report also shows how short-term attempts to avoid the biological consequences of pollution have already failed and puts forward new hypotheses about hitherto unsuspected effects of nuclear bomb testing. Narrated by Victor Henry.

results.title: Report on molybdenum
results.creator_credit: Tony Doogood, Jack Keane and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture
